speaker:
FIRST
               
              FRIEND
text: The good time of day to you, sir.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              FRIEND
text: I also wish it to you. I think this honorable

speaker:
SECOND
               
              FRIEND
text: lord did but try us this other day.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              FRIEND
text: Upon that were my thoughts tiring when

speaker:
FIRST
               
              FRIEND
text: we encountered. I hope it is not so low with him as

speaker:
FIRST
               
              FRIEND
text: he made it seem in the trial of his several friends.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              FRIEND
text: It should not be, by the persuasion of

speaker:
SECOND
               
              FRIEND
text: his new feasting.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              FRIEND
text: I should think so. He hath sent me an

speaker:
FIRST
               
              FRIEND
text: earnest inviting, which many my near occasions

speaker:
FIRST
               
              FRIEND
text: did urge me to put off; but he hath conjured me

speaker:
FIRST
               
              FRIEND
text: beyond them, and I must needs appear.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              FRIEND
text: In like manner was I in debt to my

speaker:
SECOND
               
              FRIEND
text: importunate business, but he would not hear my

speaker:
SECOND
               
              FRIEND
text: excuse. I am sorry, when he sent to borrow of me,

speaker:
SECOND
               
              FRIEND
text: that my provision was out.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              FRIEND
text: I am sick of that grief too, as I understand

speaker:
FIRST
               
              FRIEND
text: how all things go.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              FRIEND
text: Every man here’s so. What would he

speaker:
SECOND
               
              FRIEND
text: have borrowed of you?

speaker:
FIRST
               
              FRIEND
text: A thousand pieces.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              FRIEND
text: A thousand pieces!

speaker:
FIRST
               
              FRIEND
text: What of you?

speaker:
SECOND
               
              FRIEND
text: He sent to me, sir—

speaker:
SECOND
               
              FRIEND
text: Here he comes.

speaker: TIMON
text: With all my heart, gentlemen both! And how

speaker: TIMON
text: fare you?

speaker:
FIRST
               
              FRIEND
text: Ever at the best, hearing well of your

speaker:
FIRST
               
              FRIEND
text: Lordship.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              FRIEND
text: The swallow follows not summer

speaker:
SECOND
               
              FRIEND
text: more willing than we your Lordship.

speaker: TIMON
text: Nor more willingly leaves winter, such

speaker: TIMON
text: summer birds are men.—Gentlemen, our dinner

speaker: TIMON
text: will not recompense this long stay. Feast your ears

speaker: TIMON
text: with the music awhile, if they will fare so harshly

speaker: TIMON
text: o’ th’ trumpets’ sound. We shall to ’t presently.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              FRIEND
text: I hope it remains not unkindly with your

speaker:
FIRST
               
              FRIEND
text: Lordship that I returned you an empty messenger.

speaker: TIMON
text: O, sir, let it not trouble you.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              FRIEND
text: My noble lord—

speaker: TIMON
text: Ah, my good friend, what cheer?

speaker:
SECOND
               
              FRIEND
text: My most honorable lord, I am e’en

speaker:
SECOND
               
              FRIEND
text: sick of shame that when your Lordship this other

speaker:
SECOND
               
              FRIEND
text: day sent to me, I was so unfortunate a beggar.

speaker: TIMON
text: Think not on ’t, sir.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              FRIEND
text: If you had sent but two hours before—

speaker: TIMON
text: Let it not cumber your better remembrance.

speaker: TIMON
text: Come, bring in all together.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              FRIEND
text: All covered dishes!

speaker:
FIRST
               
              FRIEND
text: Royal cheer, I warrant you.

speaker:
THIRD
               
              FRIEND
text: Doubt not that, if money and the season

speaker:
THIRD
               
              FRIEND
text: can yield it.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              FRIEND
text: How do you? What’s the news?

speaker:
THIRD
               
              FRIEND
text: Alcibiades is banished. Hear you of it?

speaker:
FIRST
               
              AND
               
              SECOND
               
              FRIENDS
text: Alcibiades banished?

speaker:
THIRD
               
              FRIEND
text: ’Tis so. Be sure of it.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              FRIEND
text: How? How?

speaker:
SECOND
               
              FRIEND
text: I pray you, upon what?

speaker: TIMON
text: My worthy friends, will you draw near?

speaker:
THIRD
               
              FRIEND
text: I’ll tell you more anon. Here’s a noble

speaker:
THIRD
               
              FRIEND
text: feast toward.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              FRIEND
text: This is the old man still.

speaker:
THIRD
               
              FRIEND
text: Will ’t hold? Will ’t hold?

speaker:
SECOND
               
              FRIEND
text: It does, but time will—and so—

speaker:
THIRD
               
              FRIEND
text: I do conceive.

speaker: TIMON
text: Each man to his stool, with that spur as he

speaker: TIMON
text: would to the lip of his mistress. Your diet shall

speaker: TIMON
text: be in all places alike. Make not a city feast of it, to let

speaker: TIMON
text: the meat cool ere we can agree upon the first place.

speaker: TIMON
text:
Sit, sit.
                 
                (
                They
                 
                sit
                .
                )
               The gods require our thanks:

speaker: TIMON
text: You great benefactors, sprinkle our society with

speaker: TIMON
text: thankfulness. For your own gifts make yourselves

speaker: TIMON
text: praised, but reserve still to give, lest your deities be

speaker: TIMON
text: despised. Lend to each man enough, that one need

speaker: TIMON
text: not lend to another; for, were your godheads to

speaker: TIMON
text: borrow of men, men would forsake the gods. Make

speaker: TIMON
text: the meat be beloved more than the man that gives

speaker: TIMON
text: it. Let no assembly of twenty be without a score of

speaker: TIMON
text: villains. If there sit twelve women at the table, let a

speaker: TIMON
text: dozen of them be as they are. The rest of your fees,

speaker: TIMON
text: O gods, the Senators of Athens, together with the

speaker: TIMON
text: common tag of people, what is amiss in them,

speaker: TIMON
text: you gods, make suitable for destruction. For these

speaker: TIMON
text: my present friends, as they are to me nothing, so

speaker: TIMON
text: in nothing bless them, and to nothing are they

speaker: TIMON
text: welcome.

speaker: TIMON
text:
Uncover
              ,
               
              dogs
              ,
               
              and
               
              lap
              .

speaker:
SOME
               
              SPEAK
text:
What
               
              does
               
              his
               
              Lordship
               
              mean
              ?

speaker:
SOME
               
              OTHER
text: I know not.

speaker: TIMON
text:
May
               
              you
               
              a
               
              better
               
              feast
               
              never
               
              behold
              ,

speaker: TIMON
text:
You
               
              knot
               
              of
               
              mouth-friends
              !
               
              Smoke
               
              and
               
              lukewarm
               
              water

speaker: TIMON
text:
Is
               
              your
               
              perfection
              .
               
              This
               
              is
               
              Timon’s
               
              last
              ,

speaker: TIMON
text:
Who
              ,
               
              stuck
               
              and
               
              spangled
               
              with
               
              your
               
              flatteries
              ,

speaker: TIMON
text:
Washes
               
              it
               
              off
               
              and
               
              sprinkles
               
              in
               
              your
               
              faces

speaker: TIMON
text:
Your
               
              reeking
               
              villainy
              .

speaker: TIMON
text:
Live
               
              loathed
               
              and
               
              long
              ,

speaker: TIMON
text:
Most
               
              smiling
              ,
               
              smooth
              ,
               
              detested
               
              parasites
              ,

speaker: TIMON
text:
Courteous
               
              destroyers
              ,
               
              affable
               
              wolves
              ,
               
              meek
               
              bears
              ,

speaker: TIMON
text:
You
               
              fools
               
              of
               
              fortune
              ,
               
              trencher-friends
              ,
               
              time’s
               
              flies
              ,

speaker: TIMON
text:
Cap-and-knee
               
              slaves
              ,
               
              vapors
              ,
               
              and
               
              minute-jacks
              .

speaker: TIMON
text:
Of
               
              man
               
              and
               
              beast
               
              the
               
              infinite
               
              malady

speaker: TIMON
text:
Crust
               
              you
               
              quite
               
              o’er
              !
              
                 
                (
                They
                 
                stand
                .
                )
              
               
              What
              ,
               
              dost
               
              thou
               
              go
              ?

speaker: TIMON
text:
Soft
              !
               
              Take
               
              thy
               
              physic
               
              first
              —
              thou
               
              too
              —
              and
               
              thou
              .
              —

speaker: TIMON
text:
Stay
              .
               
              I
               
              will
               
              lend
               
              thee
               
              money
              ,
               
              borrow
               
              none
              .

speaker: TIMON
text:
What
              ?
               
              All
               
              in
               
              motion
              ?
               
              Henceforth
               
              be
               
              no
               
              feast

speaker: TIMON
text:
Whereat
               
              a
               
              villain’s
               
              not
               
              a
               
              welcome
               
              guest
              .

speaker: TIMON
text:
Burn
              ,
               
              house
              !
               
              Sink
              ,
               
              Athens
              !
               
              Henceforth
               
              hated
               
              be

speaker: TIMON
text:
Of
               
              Timon
               
              man
               
              and
               
              all
               
              humanity
              !

speaker:
FIRST
               
              FRIEND
text: How now, my lords?

speaker:
SECOND
               
              FRIEND
text: Know you the quality of Lord Timon’s

speaker:
SECOND
               
              FRIEND
text: fury?

speaker:
THIRD
               
              FRIEND
text: Push! Did you see my cap?

speaker:
FOURTH
               
              FRIEND
text: I have lost my gown.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              FRIEND
text: He’s but a mad lord, and naught but

speaker:
FIRST
               
              FRIEND
text: humors sways him. He gave me a jewel th’ other

speaker:
FIRST
               
              FRIEND
text: day, and now he has beat it out of my hat. Did you

speaker:
FIRST
               
              FRIEND
text: see my jewel?

speaker:
SECOND
               
              FRIEND
text: Did you see my cap?

speaker:
THIRD
               
              FRIEND
text: Here ’tis.

speaker:
FOURTH
               
              FRIEND
text: Here lies my gown.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              FRIEND
text: Let’s make no stay.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              FRIEND
text:
Lord
               
              Timon’s
               
              mad
              .

speaker:
THIRD
               
              FRIEND
text:
I
               
              feel
               
              ’t
               
              upon
               
              my

              .

One

              he
